programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (0-2) is after its first win this season following an 11-9 loss to Arlington; Memphis (0-2) comes off a 17-12 loss to DC, but won both meetings with the Roughnecks last season, including a 19-12 win at home behind Darius Victor.

programme.title: German Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: Expert analysis of the upcoming Bundesliga matches of the week, as the commentators discuss the league's must-see contests, club strategies and key players to watch, show highlights of past meetings, and provide injury updates around the league.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Network hosts and soccer analysts take an in-depth look at the upcoming games of top-level soccer in Germany, as they discuss performances, interview players and coaches, examine off season moves, and review highlights and up-to-date news.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 3-ranked Oklahoma (34-3) ranks third nationally with 72 home runs through its first 37 games; No. 18-ranked Oklahoma State (23-11) is just 7-44 all-time in the series but won two of three encounters against the Sooners last season.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: 2025 Masters Golf Tournament
programme.desc: The annual event, which has been held on the eve of the Masters Tournament since 1960, features a nine-hole layout, with holes ranging from 70 to 140 yards; no winner of the event has ever gone on to claim the green jacket in the same year.

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Western Michigan (32-7-1) won two of its three season meetings with Denver (31-11-1), including a 4-3 win in double OT in the NCHC Championship game behind a game-winner from Alex Bump after scoring three goals in the third to tie it.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional basketball.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: NCAA Studio Update

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: NFL Draft experts analyze the quarterback class and review potential landing spots; top names expected to hear their name called early include: Miami's Cam Ward, Colorado's Shedeur Sanders, Alabama's Jalen Milroe and Ole Miss' Jaxson Dart.

programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The premier open-wheel racing organization, Formula 1 originated in 1950 as the top drivers traveled around the world to compete for the series championship, gaining points at each stop based upon their finish in the fast-paced races.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula One drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Host Jimmy Houston uses his skills and years of experience when he goes on a fishing trip in Georgia by himself to nab some bass, discussing the methods he used to catch the fish and the tools he needed to have a successful outing.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick is traced over four decades; Parcells and Belichick first worked together as assistants with the New York Giants and have forged a bond that few men of their stature have ever experienced.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick is traced over four decades; Parcells and Belichick first worked together as assistants with the New York Giants and have forged a bond that few men of their stature have ever experienced.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas UNAM, which faced a one-goal deficit late in the second half after an own goal in the 71st minute, secured a 1-1 draw against Vancouver Whitecaps FC in the first leg on April 2, as Adalberto Carrasquilla scored the equalizer in the 87th minute.

programme.desc: The event pushes the world's top players to their physical limits as they race to throw as many strikes as possible in a two-minute window; 2024 champion Jesper Svensson, EJ Tackett, Jason Belmonte, Kris Prather and Ryan Barnes headline the field.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (0-1) dropped its opener to DC, 18-11, but won both meetings with the Panthers last season; Michigan (1-0) opened with a 26-12 win over Memphis behind a passing and rushing touchdown from Blake Perkins.

programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: NASCAR drivers go head to head with half-ton short-bed pickup trucks from manufacturers including Chevrolet, Dodge, Ford and Toyota throughout the season at the top tracks across the United States.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Brisbane (4-0-0) defeated the Bulldogs in last season's meeting 114-71, at Marvel Stadium on June 7, as Erid Hipwood equaled a career best with his match-high six goals; Western (2-2-0) comes off a 97-81 loss to Fremantle at Optus Stadium in Round 4.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Canberra (3-0-2) has won the past three meetings with the Eels across all competitions, including a 41-8 victory last season; Parramatta (1-0-4) secured its first win of the season with a 23-22 triumph over St. George Illawarra on April 4.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.sub-title: Grand Prix of Qatar 2025 Sprint Race
programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.

programme.title: Bassmasters
programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.
